repnme.cdata!: Algeria - Social Safety Net Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            are high. Lessons from project experience confirms the
            validity of the general project design, namely, the creation
            of the Social Development Agency - ADS - enabled a learning
            environment, and promoted the use of a constructive
            self-evaluation mechanism, focused on self-improvement, and
            improved program management. The ADS, and through it, the
            implementation of the project, had a catalytic effect
            because it demonstrated that a public agency, operating in
            the social service sector, can be innovative, effective, and
            achieve good results, in addition to demonstrating, and
            confirming the successful use of private contractors.
            Moreover, although the administrative framework of the ADS
            is not designed on the typical worldwide model of autonomous
            social funds, the agency is obtaining good results, and its
            structure is well suited to the administrative environment
            of the country. However, the studies carried out,
            particularly social safety net program beneficiary
            assessments, did not yield the expected results, as the
            assessments were primarily based on quantitative, rather
            than qualitative inputs; thus, during the second phase, the
            terms of reference will be enhanced, to collect concrete
            data on impact. Furthermore, in Algeria, the new concept of
            a Community Development Program will require the application
            of lessons learned, and increased efforts, elements that the
            ADS management support so as to attain the desired program
            impact. Nonetheless, it should be underlined that ADS
            structures to implement individual programs, still need
            support, particularly in light of recent changes made at the
            administrative level, which have reduced ADS's
            managerial flexibility.

5080293.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Social dev/gender/inclusion

repnme.cdata!: Algeria - Social Safety Net Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Safety Net Support Project
            complements the Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL) operation
            which focuses on the development of the private sector and
            the reform of public enterprises, public expenditures, and
            the financial sector. In particular, the project will
            demonstrate the Bank's and government's commitment
            to alleviate the social costs of adjustment and support SAL
            objectives to improve the social safety net system. The most
            important objective of the project is to create employment
            and improve infrastructure and services in disadvantaged
            areas and demonstrate the government's commitment to
            mitigate the impact of economic reforms on the poor. The
            second objective is to enhance the effectiveness of
            Algeria's social safety net system and the third
            objective is to prepare, on a pilot basis, social
            development programs aimed at developing social
            infrastructure and alleviating poverty. The project will
            consist of three main components: 1) labor intensive public
            works programs including the following three sub-components:
            (a) roadside maintenance; (b) agriculture; and (c) water
            supply and sewerage; 2) social safety net strengthening
            which will involve: (a) improvement of social assistance
            programs; and (b) community social service units; and 3)
            testing and preparation of a social fund consisting of: (a)
            pilot project for community development; and (b) preparation
            of the social fund.

            LOW-INCOMEBARRIOS IMPROVEMENT PROJ

repnme.cdata!: Algeria - Social Safety Net Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Safety Net Support Project
            complements the Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL) operation
            which focuses on the development of the private sector and
            the reform of public enterprises, public expenditures, and
            the financial sector. In particular, the project will
            demonstrate the Bank's and government's commitment
            to alleviate the social costs of adjustment and support SAL
            objectives to improve the social safety net system. The most
            important objective of the project is to create employment
            and improve infrastructure and services in disadvantaged
            areas and demonstrate the government's commitment to
            mitigate the impact of economic reforms on the poor. The
            second objective is to enhance the effectiveness of
            Algeria's social safety net system and the third
            objective is to prepare, on a pilot basis, social
            development programs aimed at developing social
            infrastructure and alleviating poverty. The project will
            consist of three main components: 1) labor intensive public
            works programs including the following three sub-components:
            (a) roadside maintenance; (b) agriculture; and (c) water
            supply and sewerage; 2) social safety net strengthening
            which will involve: (a) improvement of social assistance
            programs; and (b) community social service units; and 3)
            testing and preparation of a social fund consisting of: (a)
            pilot project for community development; and (b) preparation
            of the social fund.
